title: Brexit deal averts a recessionary shock for the world economy – but it is no panacea
text:
Europe has dodged a big bullet. So has the global financial system. A no-deal Brexit would have been the last straw for an international economy already at stall-speed and nearing the point of metastasis where serious trouble begins.

The landscape has become so treacherous that the European Central Bank has had to cut rates to minus 0.5pc and relaunch quantitative easing. The US Federal Reserve has been forced to carry out a 180-degree hand-brake turn and begin a $60bn (£46bn) blast of QE-lite each month to avert a liquidity crunch.

Morgan Stanley says the world is “one mistake away from a global recession”. It cites inverted yield curves and deflationary alarms from the bond markets; a slump...
description: Europe has dodged a big bullet.
